gr.forth.ics.jbenchy
Interface Filter

public interface Filter

An SQL-based filter. A filters is the direct analog of SQL's WHERE clause, for example Filters.eq("VAR", "X") allows only those results which do have the value "X" for variable "VAR", filtering out all the rest.

Author:
andreou
See Also:
Filters

Method Summary
 java.lang.String toSql(Schema schema)
          Returns the SQL part that can be embedded in a WHERE clause and express the semantics of this filter.
 

Method Detail

toSql

java.lang.String toSql(Schema schema)
Returns the SQL part that can be embedded in a WHERE clause and express the semantics of this filter.

Parameters:
schema - the schema of the aggregator/table that the filter will apply to. This is needed to be able to correctly render values in the SQL string, something for which in some cases the data type of the value is required
